Once cancellation is initiated, the batch enters a `canceling` state, at which time the system may complete any in-progress, non-interruptible requests before finalizing cancellation.\\n\\nThe number of canceled requests is specified in `request_counts`. To determine which requests were canceled, check the individual results within the batch. Note that cancellation may not result in any canceled requests if they were non-interruptible.\\n\\nLearn more about the Message Batches API in our [user guide](/en/docs/build-with-claude/batch-processing)\",\"href\":\"/en/api/canceling-message-batches\"},{\"openapi\":\"delete /v1/messages/batches/{message_batch_id}\",\"title\":\"Delete a Message Batch\",\"description\":\"Delete a Message Batch.\\n\\nMessage Batches can only be deleted once they've finished processing. Note that cancellation may not result in any canceled requests if they were non-interruptible.\\n\\nLearn more about the Message Batches API in our [user guide](/en/docs/build-with-claude/batch-processing)\",\"href\":\"/it/api/canceling-message-batches\"},{\"openapi\":\"delete /v1/messages/batches/{message_batch_id}\",\"title\":\"Elimina un Batch di Messaggi\",\"description\":\"Delete a Message Batch.\\n\\nMessage Batches can only be deleted once they've finished processing. To determine which requests were canceled, check the individual results within the batch. Note that cancellation may not result in any canceled requests if they were non-interruptible.\\n\\nLearn more about the Message Batches API in our [user guide](/en/docs/build-with-claude/batch-processing)\",\"href\":\"/en/api/canceling-message-batches\"},{\"openapi\":\"delete /v1/messages/batches/{message_batch_id}\",\"title\":\"Delete a Message Batch\",\"description\":\"Delete a Message Batch.\\n\\nMessage Batches can only be deleted once they've finished processing. To access the results of a Message Batch, make a request to the `results_url` field in the response.\\n\\nLearn more about the Message Batches API in our [user guide](/en/docs/build-with-claude/batch-processing)\",\"href\":\"/fr/api/retrieving-message-batches\"},{\"openapi\":\"get /v1/messages/batches/{message_batch_id}/results\",\"title\":\"R\u00e9cup\u00e9rer les R\u00e9sultats du Lot de Messages\",\"description\":\"Streams the results of a Message Batch as a `.jsonl` file.\\n\\nEach line in the file is a JSON object containing the result of a single request in the Message Batch. Results are not guaranteed to be in the same order as requests. Use the `custom_id` field to match results to requests.\\n\\nLearn more about the Message Batches API in our [user guide](/en/docs/build-with-claude/batch-processing)\",\"href\":\"/fr/api/retrieving-message-batch-results\"},{\"openapi\":\"get /v1/messages/batches\",\"title\":\"Lister les Lots de Messages\",\"description\":\"List all Message Batches within a Workspace. Most recently created batches are returned first.\\n\\nLearn more about the Message Batches API in our [user guide](/en/docs/build-with-claude/batch-processing)\",\"href\":\"/fr/api/listing-message-batches\"},{\"openapi\":\"post /v1/messages/batches/{message_batch_id}/cancel\",\"title\":\"Annuler un Lot de Messages\",\"description\":\"Batches may be canceled any time before processing ends. Once cancellation is initiated, the batch enters a `canceling` state, at which time the system may complete any in-progress, non-interruptible requests before finalizing cancellation.\\n\\nThe number of canceled requests is specified in `request_counts`. To determine which requests were canceled, check the individual results within the batch. Once cancellation is initiated, the batch enters a `canceling` state, at which time the system may complete any in-progress, non-interruptible requests before finalizing cancellation.\\n\\nThe number of canceled requests is specified in `request_counts`. To determine which requests were canceled, check the individual results within the batch. Note that cancellation may not result in any canceled requests if they were non-interruptible.\\n\\nLearn more about the Message Batches API in our [user guide](/en/docs/build-with-claude/batch-processing)\",\"href\":\"/de/api/canceling-message-batches\"},{\"openapi\":\"delete /v1/messages/batches/{message_batch_id}\",\"title\":\"Einen Nachrichten-Batch l\u00f6schen\",\"description\":\"Delete a Message Batch.\\n\\nMessage Batches can only be deleted once they've finished processing. Once cancellation is initiated, the batch enters a `canceling` state, at which time the system may complete any in-progress, non-interruptible requests before finalizing cancellation.\\n\\nThe number of canceled requests is specified in `request_counts`. To determine which requests were canceled, check the individual results within the batch. Note that cancellation may not result in any canceled requests if they were non-interruptible.\\n\\nLearn more about the Message Batches API in our [user guide](/en/docs/build-with-claude/batch-processing)\",\"href\":\"/it/api/canceling-message-batches\"},{\"openapi\":\"delete /v1/messages/batches/{message_batch_id}\",\"title\":\"Elimina un Batch di Messaggi\",\"description\":\"Delete a Message Batch.\\n\\nMessage Batches can only be deleted once they've finished processing. To access the results of a Message Batch, make a request to the `results_url` field in the response.\\n\\nLearn more about the Message Batches API in our [user guide](/en/docs/build-with-claude/batch-processing)\",\"href\":\"/ko/api/retrieving-message-batches\"},{\"openapi\":\"get /v1/messages/batches/{message_batch_id}/results\",\"title\":\"\uba54\uc2dc\uc9c0 \ubc30\uce58 \uacb0\uacfc \uac80\uc0c9\",\"description\":\"Streams the results of a Message Batch as a `.jsonl` file.\\n\\nEach line in the file is a JSON object containing the result of a single request in the Message Batch. Use the `custom_id` field to match results to requests.\\n\\nLearn more about the Message Batches API in our [user guide](/en/docs/build-with-claude/batch-processing)\",\"href\":\"/ko/api/retrieving-message-batch-results\"},{\"openapi\":\"get /v1/messages/batches\",\"title\":\"\uba54\uc2dc\uc9c0 \ubc30\uce58 \ubaa9\ub85d\",\"description\":\"List all Message Batches within a Workspace. Most recently created batches are returned first.\\n\\nLearn more about the Message Batches API in our [user guide](/en/docs/build-with-claude/batch-processing)\",\"href\":\"/ko/api/listing-message-batches\"},{\"openapi\":\"post /v1/messages/batches/{message_batch_id}/cancel\",\"title\":\"\uba54\uc2dc\uc9c0 \ubc30\uce58 \ucde8\uc18c\",\"description\":\"Batches may be canceled any time before processing ends. Once cancellation is initiated, the batch enters a `canceling` state, at which time the system may complete any in-progress, non-interruptible requests before finalizing cancellation.\\n\\nThe number of canceled requests is specified in `request_counts`. To access the results of a Message Batch, make a request to the `results_url` field in the response.\\n\\nLearn more about the Message Batches API in our [user guide](/en/docs/build-with-claude/batch-processing)\",\"href\":\"/zh-CN/api/retrieving-message-batches\"},{\"openapi\":\"get /v1/messages/batches/{message_batch_id}/results\",\"title\":\"\u83b7\u53d6\u6d88\u606f\u6279\u6b21\u7ed3\u679c\",\"description\":\"Streams the results of a Message Batch as a `.jsonl` file.\\n\\nEach line in the file is a JSON object containing the result of a single request in the Message Batch. Results are not guaranteed to be in the same order as requests. Use the `custom_id` field to match results to requests.\\n\\nLearn more about the Message Batches API in our [user guide](/en/docs/build-with-claude/batch-processing)\",\"href\":\"/zh-CN/api/retrieving-message-batch-results\"},{\"openapi\":\"get /v1/messages/batches\",\"title\":\"\u5217\u51fa\u6d88\u606f\u6279\u6b21\",\"description\":\"List all Message Batches within a Workspace. Most recently created batches are returned first.\\n\\nLearn more about the Message Batches API in our [user guide](/en/docs/build-with-claude/batch-processing)\",\"href\":\"/zh-CN/api/listing-message-batches\"},{\"openapi\":\"post /v1/messages/batches/{message_batch_id}/cancel\",\"title\":\"\u53d6\u6d88\u6d88\u606f\u6279\u6b21\",\"description\":\"Batches may be canceled any time before processing ends. Once cancellation is initiated, the batch enters a `canceling` state, at which time the system may complete any in-progress, non-interruptible requests before finalizing cancellation.\\n\\nThe number of canceled requests is specified in `request_counts`. To determine which requests were canceled, check the individual results within the batch. Note that cancellation may not result in any canceled requests if they were non-interruptible.\\n\\nLearn more about the Message Batches API in our [user guide](/en/docs/build-with-claude/batch-processing)\",\"href\":\"/zh-CN/api/canceling-message-batches\"},{\"openapi\":\"delete /v1/messages/batches/{message_batch_id}\",\"title\":\"\u5220\u9664\u6d88\u606f\u6279\u6b21\",\"description\":\"Delete a Message Batch.\\n\\nMessage Batches can only be deleted once they've finished processing. To determine which requests were canceled, check the individual results within the batch. To access the results of a Message Batch, make a request to the `results_url` field in the response.\\n\\nLearn more about the Message Batches API in our [user guide](/en/docs/build-with-claude/batch-processing)\",\"href\":\"/id/api/retrieving-message-batches\"},{\"openapi\":\"get /v1/messages/batches/{message_batch_id}/results\",\"title\":\"Mengambil Hasil Batch Pesan\",\"description\":\"Streams the results of a Message Batch as a `.jsonl` file.\\n\\nEach line in the file is a JSON object containing the result of a single request in the Message Batch. Use the `custom_id` field to match results to requests.\\n\\nLearn more about the Message Batches API in our [user guide](/en/docs/build-with-claude/batch-processing)\",\"href\":\"/id/api/retrieving-message-batch-results\"},{\"openapi\":\"get /v1/messages/batches\",\"title\":\"Daftar Batch Pesan\",\"description\":\"List all Message Batches within a Workspace. Once cancellation is initiated, the batch enters a `canceling` state, at which time the system may complete any in-progress, non-interruptible requests before finalizing cancellation.\\n\\nThe number of canceled requests is specified in `request_counts`.
